text.div:
CPGonEBMonFHIRtemplate

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

https://www.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de/fhir/cpg-on-ebmonfhir/example/ImplementationGuide/template.cpg-on-ebmonfhir.netzwerk-universitaetsmedizin.de

Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

DIGIPOD
resource.description: Concepts required in recommendations that are not defined elsewhere for the project DIGIPOD

resource.name: DIGIPOD to standardized vocabularies
resource.description: Concept map from concepts defined in DIGIPOD to standardized vocabularies

Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperative at Risk for POD
resource.description: Adult patients before undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia and being at risk for postoperative delirium

resource.name: Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively with Positive Mini-cog Test Score
resource.description: Adult patients with a positive Mini-cog test score before undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia

resource.name: Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively with Positive Mini-cog Test Score that need a Mini-Mental State Examination
resource.description: Adult patients with a positive Mini-cog test score that need a Mini-Mental State Examination before undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Intraoperatively
resource.description: Adult patients during an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively On Normal Ward, With a RASS Equal Or Lower Than -3
resource.description: Adult patients after undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia, on normal ward, with a RASS of -3 or less.

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively on the Surgery Day on an Intensive Care Unit
resource.description: Adult patients after undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia, on the day of the surgical intervention (from the time of completion of the procedure to midnight), on an intensive care unit.

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively on the Surgery Day on Normal Ward or in the Recovery Room
resource.description: Adult patients after undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia, on the day of the surgical intervention (from the time of completion of the procedure to midnight), in the recovery room or on normal ward.

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Pre- and Intraoperatively
resource.description: Adult patients before and/or during an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively
resource.description: Adult patients before undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia

resource.name: Population: General Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively on Surgery Day and Before
resource.description: Adult patients before undergoing an elective surgical intervention of any type independently of the type of anesthesia, on the day of the surgical intervention or maximum 42 days before.

resource.name: Population: Older Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively
resource.description: Adult patients being 70 years old or older, before undergoing a surgical intervention of any type

resource.name: PractitionerRoleClaudiaSpies
Recommendation 0.1: Preoperative screening of delirium
resource.description: Recommendation number 0.1 (Prerequisite) from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 0.2: Postoperative screening of delirium
resource.description: Recommendation number 0.2 (Prerequisite) from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 2.1: Preoperative Risk Factors
resource.description: Recommendation number 2.1 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 3.1: Preventive Measures I (Effects of Drugs on POD prevention) - Drugs as prophylactic measure to reduce the incidence of POD
resource.description: Recommendation number 3.1 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 3.2: Preventive Measures I (Effects of Drugs on POD prevention) - Preventive dexmedetomidine administration intra- or postoperative
resource.description: Recommendation number 3.2 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 3.3: Preventive Measures I (Effects of Drugs on POD prevention) - Type of surgery or anesthesia to reduce the incidence of POD
resource.description: Recommendation number 3.3 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 3.4: Preventive Measures I (Effects of Drugs on POD prevention) - Biomarker to identify patients at risk of POD
resource.description: Recommendation number 3.4 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 4.1: Preventive Measures II (Non Pharmacological Interventions) - Screening for risk factors and optimizing preoperative status in older adults
resource.description: Recommendation number 4.1 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 4.2: Preventive Measures II (Non Pharmacological Interventions) - Sharing, discussing and documenting results of risk factors and preventive strategies
resource.description: Recommendation number 4.2 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 4.3: Preventive Measures II (Non Pharmacological Interventions) - Multi-component non-pharmacological interventions in all patients at risk for POD
resource.description: Recommendation number 4.3 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 5.1: Neuromonitoring - EEG monitoring depth of anesthesia guidance
resource.description: Recommendation number 5.1 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 5.2: Neuromonitoring - Multi-parameter, intraoperative EEG monitoring during anesthesia
resource.description: Recommendation number 5.2 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 6.1: Pharmacological Treatment of POD and POD Outcomes - Low-dose haloperidol as treatment
resource.description: Recommendation number 6.1 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 6.2: Pharmacological Treatment of POD and POD Outcomes - Benzodiazepines as treatment
resource.description: Recommendation number 6.2 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation 6.3: Pharmacological Treatment of POD and POD Outcomes - Dexmedetomidine as treatment in patients with cardiac surgery
resource.description: Recommendation number 6.3 from Guideline 'Update of the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients'

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Check risk factors in Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients that will undergo a surgical intervention: Check risk factors age, American Society of Anesthesiology Physical status score (ASA), Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI) and Mini-cog test score (Mini-cog). If Mini-cog test score is equal to or higher than 3, perform Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA), Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination (ACE-R) or Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE). Please note that MMSE is not free of charge (license fees)

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Do no suggest any specific type of surgery and type of anaesthesia to reduce the incidence of POD in Adult Surgical Patients Pre- or Intraoperatively
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients before or during a surgical intervention: Do no suggest any specific type of surgery and type of anaesthesia to reduce the incidence of postoperative delirium (POD).

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Do no suggest using any single specific biomarker to identify patients at risk of POD in Adult Surgical Patients Pre- or Intraoperatively
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients before or during a surgical intervention: Do no suggest using any single specific biomarker to identify patients at risk of postoperative delirium (POD).

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Perform Baseline Delirium Screening in Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients that will undergo a surgical intervention: Perform baseline delirium screening.

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Perform Delirium Screening in Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively on surgery day during the evening shift
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients that had a surgical intervention: Perform delirium screening on surgery day during the evening shift.

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Perform Delirium Screening in Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively on surgery day during the morning shift
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients that had a surgical intervention: Perform delirium screening on surgery day during the morning shift.

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Perform Delirium Screening in Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively on surgery day during the night shift
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients that had a surgical intervention: Perform delirium screening on surgery day during the night shift.

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Perform Delirium Screening in Adult Surgical Patients Postoperatively on surgery day, ideally once a shift and at least twice a day
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients that had a surgical intervention: Perform delirium screening on surgery day, ideally once a shift and at least twice a day.

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Use Index-based EEG monitoring depth of anaesthesia guidance in Adult Surgical Patients Intraoperatively
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients during a surgical intervention: Use Index-based EEG monitoring depth of anaesthesia guidance

resource.name: Recommendation Collection: Use multiparameter EEG monitoring in Adult Surgical Patients Intraoperatively
resource.description: Recommendation collection for adult patients during a surgical intervention: Use multiparameter electroencephalographic (EEG) monitoring focusing on burst suppression activity and including the density spectral array (DSA).

resource.name: Recommended Action for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Intraoperatively, perform monitoring burst suppression pattern using electroencephalography
resource.description: Recommended Action for Adult Surgical Patients, Intraoperatively, burst suppression patterns should be monitored using electroencephalography (EEG).

resource.name: Recommended Action for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Intraoperatively, use electroencephalographic density spectral array
resource.description: Recommended Action for Adult Surgical Patients, Intraoperatively, EEG monitoring must include density spectral array (DSA)

resource.name: Recommended Action for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Intraoperatively, use Index-based EEG monitoring depth of anaesthesia guidance
resource.description: Recommended Action for Adult Surgical Patients, Intraoperatively, use Index-based EEG monitoring depth of anaesthesia guidance to decrease the risk of POD.

resource.name: Recommended Plan for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Pre- or Intraoperatively, do not suggest using any single specific biomarker to identify patients at risk of POD
resource.description: Recommended Plan for Adult Surgical Patients Pre- or Intraoperatively, do not suggest using any single specific biomarker to identify patients at risk of postoperative delirium (POD) and show recommendation 3.4.

resource.name: Recommended Plan for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively with Positive Mini-cog Test Score that need a Mini-Mental State Examination, provide warning because of MMSE license fees
resource.description: Recommended Plan for Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively with Positive Mini-cog Test Score that need a Mini-Mental State Examination, provide warning because of MMSE license fees.

resource.name: Recommended Plan for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively with Positive Mini-cog Test Score, check risk factor Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score, Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination revised (ACE-R) score or Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) score
resource.description: Recommended Plan for Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively if Mini-cog test score is equal to or higher than 3, check risk factors Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score, Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination revised (ACE-R) score or Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) score.

resource.name: Recommended Plan for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively, check risk factors age, ASA, CCI and Mini-cog
resource.description: Recommended Plan for Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively, check risk factors age, American Society of Anesthesiology Physical status score (ASA), Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI) and Mini-cog test score (Mini-cog).

resource.name: Recommended Plan for Population: Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively, Perform Baseline Delirium Screening
resource.description: Recommended Plan for Adult Surgical Patients Preoperatively, perform baseline delirium screening.

resource.description: Evidence-based and consensus-based guideline on postoperative delirium in adult patients, updated by the European Society of Anaesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine (ESAIC) in 2021
